Key Match Events: South Africa posted 194 for four from their 20 overs in the Super Eights stage
Quinton de Kock did the damage with the bat for South Africa, hitting five sixes and seven fours in a 40-ball 74
Andries Gous was the lynchpin of the US innings, blasting an unbeaten 80 from 47 balls
Post-Match Reflections: Quinton de Kock is player of the match
Aidan Markram says, “A couple of lessons to takeaway, but nice for the batters to be in the middle and get some runs, especially for Quinny to really get his flow”
USA captain Aaron Jones: “It’s hard to take a defeat after coming so close but we did lack discipline in the bowling, at times”
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa go top of Group 2
The win put South Africa top of Group 2, with England and West Indies kicking off their second-round stage on Thursday
Others: The game looked dead but some remarkable and gutsy hitting from Andries Gous and Harmeet Singh saw the host nation roar back into contention
USA made their debut in the competition
The Americans failed to chase down the second-innings total to lose the opening Super Eight match
